results.title: Australian diary. No. 019
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a giant project in Tasmania is underway to convert water into power; swimming stars form a water ballet; oyster growing near Newcastle is turning into a science and a crowd thrilling game takes place between International Rugby teams of New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 017
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following are the stories featured in this popular newsreel series: past champions show the evolution of swimming; Australia’s part in the Children’s Food Relief campaign; country boys enjoy a seaside Fitness Camp; Mildura is a triumph of irrigation.

results.title: Australian Defence Scientific Service: 1969 report
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Carter
results.brief_description: The Australian Defence Scientific Service undertakes research in various fields. In the laboratories of the Weapons Research Establishment and other Commonwealth scientific areas, shows the research in thin film optics, and high-speed photography in the testing of explosives and munitions.

results.title: Australian Defence Scientific Service: 1968 film report
results.brief_description: The Australian Defence Scientific Service of the Department of Supply carries out an extensive programme of research into a variety of scientific disciplines. Work currently being carried out is an investigation of the laser, and its applications and the development of new techniques in the manufacture of micro-circuit systems. Gives a brief account of the present state of research in these fields. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian defence feature
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Greg Parry
results.brief_description: Three magazine-type features that have been put together to make this 24 minute film. The first segment titled ‘Cat and Arrest’ shows the training and the initial landing of Navy Skyhawk pilots on the aircraft carrier HMAS Melbourne. The second ‘On Target’ shows the clearance of potentially explosive ordnance from the Evans Head bombing range under an Air Force program while the third item ‘Rescue 036’ shows the ‘rescue’ of a pilot after a simulated helicopter crash near the Army Aviation Centre at Oakley in Queensland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Greg Parry

results.title: Australian childhood: changes over 200 years
results.brief_description: Overviews childhood and adolescence in Australia from 1788 to 1990’s, using photographs, archival footage and printed material. Includes the topics of children’s work, access to education, children’s health, Aboriginal children, the impact of radio and TV, teenagers and consumerism and multi-cultural Australia. Provides a “potted view” of history from the perspective of children and their changing role in our society.

results.title: Australian Capital Territory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Australia’s capital city, although relatively young, offers a range of cultural, historical and natural attractions. Enjoy panoramic views of Canberra from a hot air balloon, a ride into Snowy River country, a 4WD adventure through the ACT or a coach tour to the War Memorial, the National Film and Sound Archive, Parliament House or the National Art Gallery.
